queries.query_string: create table if not exists testTable (text varchar(100), id int);
queries.query_description: In this building block a user creates a testTable to perform actions on the table that will cause a policy violation

In this building block a user runs multiple queries associated with XSS, where the user inserts Javascript into the database testTable, then selects and deletes rows
 - If running individually, user must run the Create testTable for Policy violations building block first. It has an ID of 1

In this building block a user runs multiple queries associated with SQL Injection. The user tries to return rows from the database by manipulating the WHERE clause of an SQL query to create a condition that is always true
 - If running individually, user must run the Create testTable for Policy violations building block first. It has an ID of 1

In this building block a user runs multiple queries associated with SQL Injection. The user tries to return rows from the database by manipulating the WHERE clause of an SQL query to create a condition that is always true
 - If running individually, user must run the Create testTable for Policy violations building block first. It has an ID of 1

In this building block a user runs multiple queries associated with SQL Injection. The user tries to return rows from the database by manipulating the WHERE clause of an SQL query to create a condition that is always true
 - If running individually, user must run the Create testTable for Policy violations building block first. It has an ID of 1

In this building block the user will run some OS commands injected into SQL queries to create a policy violation for OS Command injection
 - If running individually, user must run the Create testTable for Policy violations building block first. It has an ID of 1

queries.query_string: {bruteforce:BFUSER{i}}
queries.query_usecase: Many failed attempts by multiple DB users from the same client IP
queries.query_description: In this building block the user will run multiple connection attempts with multiple different users

queries.query_string: {bruteforce:DORMANT}
queries.query_usecase: Failed login attempts by dormant user
queries.query_description:
In this building block the user will run multiple connection attempts with a dormant user
 - Change username to match a dormant user in the databse. Change the Dormant value to be a user in the DB who has been inactive

This building block is part of a Malicious procedure story
 It can be run indivdually as part of a manual sequence with building blocks 8(Call STP Account Groups) and 9(Malicious STP Update Account Groups) 
 - The sequence is 7,8,9,8 to get the desired effect of a Malicious procedure violation  
 - Execute as Polly
- Create Table
- Insert values
- Create Stored Procedures

This building block is part of a Malicious procedure story
 It can be run indivdually as part of a manual sequence with building blocks 7(Create STP Account Groups) and 9(Malicious STP Update Account Groups)  
 - The sequence is 7,8,9,8 to get the desired effect of a Malicious procedure violation
 - Execute as Jason or John
- Call Stored Procedures

queries.query_string:
DROP PROCEDURE IF EXISTS move_to_platinum;
CREATE PROCEDURE move_to_platinum (IN user_id VARCHAR(255)) BEGIN     DROP TABLE account_groups ; END;
queries.query_description:
This building block is part of a Malicious procedure story
 It can be run indivdually as part of a manual sequence with building blocks 7(Create STP Account Groups) and 8(Call STP Account Groups)   
 - The sequence is 7,8,9,8 to get the desired effect of a Malicious procedure violation
 - Execute as Liher
- Replace Stored Procedures (drop table)

queries.query_string: CREATE USER 'NEWUSER{i}'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY 'guardium';
queries.query_description:
In this building block the user will create multiple users in the database. This can be run as an individual block or in sequence with building block 11(Grant privileges to Multiple users) and 12(Delete Multiple users) to clean up and reset.

 The mentioned blocks can also be run in story mode as Massive grants violation

queries.query_string: GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON *.* TO 'NEWUSER{i}'@'%';
queries.query_description:
In this building block the user will grant privileges to  multiple users in the database. This can be run in sequence with building block 10(Create Multipe users) and 12(Delete Multiple users) to clean up and reset.

 The mentioned blocks can also be run in story mode as Massive grants violation

queries.query_string: DROP USER 'NEWUSER{i}'@'%';
queries.query_description:
In this building block the user will drop multiple users in the database. This can be run in sequence with building block 10(Create Multipe users) and 11(Grant privileges to Multiple users).

 The mentioned blocks can also be run in story mode as Massive grants violation

queries.query_string: UPDATE crm.tbl_product SET quantity = quantity + 1 WHERE id = (SELECT id FROM (SELECT id FROM crm.tbl_product ORDER BY RAND() LIMIT 1) AS r);
queries.query_description: In this query we Update a rows in tbl_product
